overview: From 2025-06-01 to 2025-07-01, elizaos/eliza had 94 new PRs (83 merged), 23 new issues, and 38 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Creating room via REST API first works but then returns empty rooms array
topIssues.author: exitsimulation
topIssues.body:
**Describe the bug**

I am creating a room for an existing agent via the Rest API which returns a success response

POST `/api/agents/b850bc30-45f8-0041-a00a-83df46d8555d/rooms` with 
```
{
  "name": "TestRoom",
  "worldId": "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000",
  "roomId": "c06bb360-e84f-49ff-b43a-75a9eb6df8f3",
  "enitityId": "b850bc30-45f8-0041-a00a-83df46d8555d"
}
```

Response:
```
{
    "success": true,
    "data": {
        "id": "143da10d-b1e5-00cb-b315-a64f6062d9de",
        "name": "TestRoom",
        "agentId": "b850bc30-45f8-0041-a00a-83df46d8555d",
        "createdAt": 1749153906448,
        "source": "client",
        "type": "dm",
        "worldId": "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000",
        "serverId": "server-1749153906404"
    }
}
```

Now, the strange thing is then when I call the rooms endpoint via GET
`api/agents/b850bc30-45f8-0041-a00a-83df46d8555d/rooms`

I am getting an empty array

```
{
    "success": true,
    "data": {
        "rooms": []
    }
}
```

Also the ID in the success response is not the one that I supplied in the request.

It seems like internally the room has not been created despite the success response?

Is this a bug in the current version? I am on 1.0.4. Any help would be appreciated!

topIssues.title: Doesn't work this evm plugin -> @elizaos/plugin-evm
topIssues.author: 0xopsdev
topIssues.body:
I want to run evm ai agent with using plugin-evm
Inside characters/degen.character.json file I set evm plugins and modelprovider as openai.
Then set openai key to .env file
I also import plugin-coingecko, but it works with fetch token price or etc.
But If I want to swap tokens or transfer tokens, it doesn't work

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/caece970-2e01-4591-858c-1ea8842bdfd0)

topIssues.title: agentId and roomId are required
topIssues.author: omariosman
topIssues.body:
When I start my agent using `elizaos start` I encounter these errors:
```
ERROR: [SocketIO] agentId and roomId are required
ERROR: [SocketIO] No agents found in room b850bc30-45f8-0041-a00a-83df46d8555d
```

How can I solve this?

### This is my .env
```
# EVM Configuration
EVM_PRIVATE_KEY=0x123...etc        
EVM_PROVIDER_URL=
OPENAI_API_KEY=
```

### My `src/index.ts`
```
import {
  logger,
  type Character,
  type IAgentRuntime,
  type Project,
  type ProjectAgent,
} from '@elizaos/core';

export const character: Character = {
  name: 'Eliza',
  plugins: [
    '@elizaos/plugin-evm',
    '@elizaos/plugin-sql',
    ...(process.env.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-anthropic'] : []),
    ...(process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-openai'] : []),
    ...(!process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-local-ai'] : []),
    ...(process.env.DISCORD_API_TOKEN ? ['@elizaos/plugin-discord'] : []),
    ...(process.env.TWITTER_USERNAME ? ['@elizaos/plugin-twitter'] : []),
    ...(process.env.TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN ? ['@elizaos/plugin-telegram'] : []),
    ...(!process.env.IGNORE_BOOTSTRAP ? ['@elizaos/plugin-bootstrap'] : []),
  ],
  settings: {
    secrets: {},
    chains: {
      "evm": [
        "mainnet" 
      ]
    }
  },
```

topIssues.title: Web client thinks it is on a different version
topIssues.author: scottrepreneur
topIssues.body: **Describe the bug** The web client shows `v1.0.3` but the cli and core are on `v1.0.4` **To Reproduce** 1. `elizaos create` 2. select defaults 3. cd & `elizaos start` 4. open web client 5. see incorrect version and update spaz banner **Expected behavior** Should see matching version in web client ```bash Version: 1.0.4 [2025-06-04 13:38:06] WARN: Server authentication is disabled. Set ELIZA_SERVER_AUTH_TOKEN environment variable to enable. Startup successful! Go to the dashboard at http://localhost:3000 ``` **Screenshots** https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c435654e-56df-4ecd-93f5-3faf2d1db91c **Additional Context** elizaos: `v1.0.4` Mac: `15.5`

topPRs.title: Add plugin specifications to core
topPRs.author: lalalune
topPRs.body:
This PR adds plugin specifications to core

Everything should work as it has, and there should be no need to modify any code outside of core to engage this specification functionality.

In the future, plugins can be migrated to import the v2 specification from @elizaos/core/v2 and we will do our best to support forward compatibility with v3, v4, etc

topPRs.title: feat: refactor message server to be completely separate and standalone from agents
topPRs.author: lalalune
topPRs.body:
This PR updates the message server to use standalone and switches the core to use specs

Summary by CodeRabbit
New Features

Introduced a centralized messaging system with support for servers, channels (including group and DM), participants, and messages, enabling real-time chat and group conversations.
Added UI components for group channels, agent cards, group cards, and a group creation page.
Implemented file and media attachment support in chat and group conversations.
Enhanced sidebar and home page to display central servers and group channels.
Added offline status detection and improved connection handling.
Improvements

Refactored chat and group chat components to use centralized channels and messages.
Upgraded API client and hooks for new messaging, agent, and group management endpoints.
Improved optimistic UI updates and error handling for message sending and file uploads.
Enhanced agent and group navigation with direct message and group chat flows.
Bug Fixes

Improved error handling and logging for network and API failures.
Fixed message deduplication and sorting in chat views.
Documentation

Added detailed documentation for versioned plugin APIs and migration guides.
Tests

Added comprehensive unit and integration tests for new messaging, state conversion, provider compatibility, and search utilities.
Chores

Updated dependencies and improved internal type safety and code organization.

The issue was that agents were processing and responding to any agent_response mess

topContributors.summary: wtfsayo: Merged 3 PRs this month, focusing on bug fixes and optimizations including fixing ElizaOS startup for plugins (#4873), resolving failing CLI CI test suites (#4870), and optimizing plugin loading to reduce startup log spam (#4868), collectively modifying 44 files (+662/-1392 lines). Has one open PR (#4866) for handling sidebar on mobile with Tailwind upgrade. Contributed to discussions by commenting on 3 issues and created issue #4309 (now closed).

ChristopherTrimboli: Merged 4 PRs this month, focusing primarily on build process improvements and bug fixes. Notable contributions include enhancing the core package build process in PR #4874 (+60/-38 lines) and fixing linter formatting issues in PR #4878 (+18/-14 lines). Also provided 2 approving reviews for other team members' work, with all activity concentrated on a single day this month.

0xbbjoker: Opened one substantial PR (#4869) proposing to replace PGLite message bus with a faster in-memory implementation, contributing significant code changes (+1138/-674 lines across 18 files). Provided 2 approving reviews on other PRs and added 1 PR comment. Activity was limited to a single day this month.

lalalune: Made significant code changes across 474 files (+55,768/-25,067 lines) in 19 commits, with sporadic activity this month. Merged two small PRs: #4863 creating .cursorrules (+228 lines) and #4862 adding an example of prompt injection for future LLM trainings (+7 lines). Has an open PR (#4864) for refactoring the message server to be completely separate.

K1mc4n: Made a single documentation contribution this month with PR #4867, updating README_IND.md with 19 additions and 1 deletion. The PR was merged after 11 hours, representing their only activity during this period.
github-advanced-security: Minimal activity this month with only a single code review comment provided. No pull requests, issues, or code changes were made during this period.
davidjsonn: Made a single documentation contribution this month by fixing errors in CHANGELOG.md through PR #4875 (+2/-2 lines). This small but helpful bugfix was merged within 4 hours of submission.
techcomthanh: Opened one issue (#4872) regarding removing requirements from newly created plugins. No other activity this month.
ceeriil: Opened one issue (#4876) regarding fallback mechanisms for package installation when Bun fails on macOS. No other activity this month.
BinaryBluePeach: Opened a single issue (#4861) regarding plugin installation problems with the giphy plugin. No other contributions were made this month.
